item.title: AUC and accuracy considered harmful to model selection
item.description: It’s pretty hard to build a predictive model, let’s be honest. My previous post was about the strange practice of under-/oversampling. We impose this on ourselves because we want to do yes/no classification instead of predicting probability. This post is on the same theme. It has a very clear message: if we use accuracy-like model performance measures (looking at you, AUC, F1, etc.) we reduce our ability to select the best model.
